preface.title: Preface
preface.para: This guide provides instructions for installing and configuring ${projectName}, a high-performance reverse proxy server with specialized session management and credential replay functionality.

As a reverse proxy server (also referred to as a gateway in HTTP RFCs), ${projectName} filters all traffic to and from a server application, adapting requests to protect the service and adapting responses to filter outgoing content. The credential replay functionality effectively enables single sign-on with applications that do not integrate easily into a traditional single sign-on service.

itemizedlist.para: In reading and following the instructions in this guide, you will learn how to:

listitem.para: Install ${projectName} and evaluate all ${projectName} features
Protect server applications and integrate them with single sign-on solutions
Use ${projectName} to allow an existing application to act as an OAuth 2.0 resource server
Use ${projectName} to allow an existing application to act as an OAuth 2.0 client or OpenID Connect 1.0 Relying Party
Use ${projectName} to allow an existing application to act as a SAML 2.0 Service Provider
Configure ${projectName} to handle authentication in common use cases
Monitor and audit traffic flowing through ${projectName}
Extend ${projectName} with Groovy scripts and Java plugins
Troubleshoot typical problems

section.title: Using This Guide
section.para: This guide is intended for access management designers and administrators who develop, build, deploy, and maintain ${projectName} for their organizations.
This guide is written so you can get started with ${projectName} quickly, and learn more as you progress through the guide.

itemizedlist.para: This guide is also written with the assumption that you already have basic familiarity with the following topics:

listitem.para: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP), including how clients and servers exchange messages, and the role that a reverse proxy (gateway) plays
JavaScript Object Notation (JSON), which is the format for ${projectName} configuration files
Managing services on operating systems and application servers
Configuring network connections on operating systems
Managing Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) used to establish HTTPS connections
Access management for web applications

itemizedlist.para: Depending on the features you use, you should also have basic familiarity with the following topics:

listitem.para: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) if you use ${projectName} with LDAP directory services
Structured Query Language (SQL) if you use ${projectName} with relational databases
Configuring OpenAM if you use password capture and replay, or if you plan to follow the OAuth 2.0 or SAML 2.0 tutorials
The Groovy programming language if you plan to extend ${projectName} with scripts
